001package imagingbook.common.image;
002
003import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
004import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
005import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
006import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
007import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
008
009/**
010 * <p>
011 * This class implements horizontal and vertical projections of scalar-valued
012 * images. See Sec. 8.7 of [1] for additional details. 
013 * </p>
014 * <p>
015 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
016 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
017 * </p>
018 * 
019 * @author WB
020 * @version 2022/09/28
021 *
022 */
023public class Projection {
024        
025        private final double[] pHor, pVer;
026
027        /**
028         * Constructor, works only on images of type {@link ByteProcessor},
029         * {@link ShortProcessor}, and {@link FloatProcessor}.
030         * Throws an exception if the specified image is of type
031         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
032         * 
033         * @param ip the image to process
034         */
035        public Projection(ImageProcessor ip) {
036                this.pHor = new double[ip.getHeight()];
037                this.pVer = new double[ip.getWidth()];
038                
039                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor || ip instanceof ShortProcessor) {
040                        makeProjectionsInt(ip);
041                }
042
043                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor) {
044                        makeProjectionsFloat((FloatProcessor) ip);
045                }
046                else {
047                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("projections not implemented for ColorProcessor");
048                }
049        }
050        
051        /**
052         * Returns the horizontal projection of the associated image.
053         * The length of the returned array corresponds to the image height.
054         * @return the horizontal projection array
055         */
056        public double[] getHorizontal() {
057                return this.pHor;
058        }
059        
060        /**
061         * Returns the vertical projection of the associated image.
062         * The length of the returned array corresponds to the image width.
063         * @return the vertical projection array
064         */
065        public double[] getVertical() {
066                return this.pVer;
067        }
068        
069        // ----------------------------------------------------------
070        
071        private void makeProjectionsInt(ImageProcessor ip) {
072                long[] lHor = new long[pHor.length];
073                long[] lVer = new long[pVer.length];
074                for (int v = 0; v < pHor.length; v++) {
075                        for (int u = 0; u < pVer.length; u++) {
076                                long p = ip.get(u, v);
077                                lHor[v] +=  p;
078                                lVer[u] +=  p;
079                        }
080                }
081                copyArray(lHor, pHor);
082                copyArray(lVer, pVer);
083        }
084        
085        private void makeProjectionsFloat(FloatProcessor ip) {
086                for (int v = 0; v < pHor.length; v++) {
087                        for (int u = 0; u < pVer.length; u++) {
088                                double p = ip.getf(u, v);
089                                pHor[v] +=  p;
090                                pVer[u] +=  p;
091                        }
092                }
093        }
094
095        private void copyArray(long[] la, double[] da) {
096                for (int i = 0; i < la.length; i++) {
097                        da[i] = la[i];
098                }
099        }
100
101}
